alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 03 at 10:46PM CST until January 03 at 11:45PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Jasper County in east central Mississippi... Clarke County in east central Mississippi... Northeastern Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1145 PM CST. * At 1046 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Sandersville, or 7 miles northeast of Laurel, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Sandersville around 1050 PM CST. Heidelberg around 1100 PM CST. Stafford Springs around 1105 PM CST. Goodwater and Barnett around 1110 PM CST. De Soto around 1120 PM CST. Quitman around 1125 PM CST. Sykes and Crandall around 1135 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Shubuta. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
